text: The 1967 Philadelphia Phillies season consisted of the Phillies' 82–80 finish, good for fifth place in the National League, 19½ games behind the NL and World Series Champion St. Louis Cardinals. The Phillies would not finish above .500 again until 1975. == Offseason == * November 28, 1966: Bo Belinsky was drafted from the Phillies by the Houston Astros in the 1966 rule 5 draft.Bo Belinsky at Baseball Reference * November 30, 1966: Darold Knowles and cash were traded by the Phillies to the Washington Senators for Don Lock.Darold Knowles at Baseball Reference * December 10, 1966: Joe Verbanic and cash were traded by the Phillies to the New York Yankees for Pedro Ramos.Pedro Ramos at Baseball Reference * December 21, 1966: Rubén Gómez was acquired by the Phillies from the Rojos del Águila de Veracruz.Rubén Gómez at Baseball Reference == Regular season == === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Notable transactions === * June 5, 1967: Pedro Ramos was released by the Phillies. * June 6, 1967: Bob Uecker was traded by the Phillies to the Atlanta Braves for Gene Oliver.Bob Uecker at Baseball Reference * June 22, 1967: Dick Groat was purchased from the Phillies by the San Francisco Giants.Dick Groat at Baseball Reference ===Game log=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !colspan="2"|Legend |- | style="background:#bfb;"| ||Phillies win |- |
